intro: Actaea spicata var. nigra, commonly known as black cohosh, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It features a tall, unbranched stem that can grow up to 1.5 meters in height, adorned with large, compound leaves that are deeply lobed. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers in late spring to early summer. Its roots are the primary part used in traditional and modern herbal medicine. The plant thrives in moist, rich woodland soils and is often found in shaded environments.
